name: Logdm
tagline: Modules for Legend of the Green Dragon
body:
Modules for version 1.x.x - Modules, Skins and third party support files for version 1.x.x. These are NOT compatible with version 0.9.7

 Administrative Modules - Additional features and improvements to the game administration tools.

 Clan Modules - Additional mods for Clans

 Dwellings - Modules for the Dwelling system

 Forest Events - Special events for the forest

 Forest Modules - Additional modules for forest activities, not including special events.

 German Language (Deutsch) - Modules written in German.

 Lodge Points - Assorted modules for use in the lodge (donator points)

 LoGD Game Add-Ons - Non modularized add-ons for the LOGD game.

 Miscellaneous - Modules and files which couldn't be pigeonholed elsewhere can be found here.

 Other Languages - Modules written in languages other than English and German

 Patches - Game modifications which require alteration of core code.

 Races - Additional races

 Shades Modules - Additional modules for the Shades (Graveyard), including special events.

 Specialties - Additional Specialties

 Templates - Skins aka Themes aka Templates provide different looks for your game.

 Travel Events - Special Events specifically for Travel

 Unsupported Core Modifications - Modified core files, ostensibly to extend functionality. These files should only be used by experienced admins, and are UNSUPPORTED by DragonPrime. Use at your own risk.

 Village Add-Ons - Village features, such as Shops and other places to visit or see.

 Village Events - Special Events for the Village

 Vital Stats Display - Modules which add to the player's vital stats display.

***


`### Welcome to GitHub Pages.`
`This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new `gh-pages` branch locally. If you’re using GitHub Desktop, simply sync your repository and you’ll see the new branch.`

`***`

`### Designer Templates`
`We’ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.`

`### Creating pages manually`
`If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.`

`### Authors and Contributors`
`You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.`

`### Support or Contact`
`Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.`
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
